item.title: Educational attainment: surveys vs. administrative records
item.description: Problem Data Results: Scatter plots Closer look at ISSP By-project and by-country plots with Przemek Powałko tl;dr: General population surveys with representative samples should have a similar education structure as shown by data from administrative sources, especially if survey weights are used. In this post we compare cross-national survey data from the SUrvey Data Recycling project with educational attainment statistics from the OECD.

item.title: Shiny app for exploring harmonized cross-national survey data (SDR v.1.0)
item.description: Instructions References In the previous post I wrote about downloading and exploring the Survey Data Recycling (SDR), version 1.0 dataset, which consists of selected harmonized variables from 22 survey projects, 1966-2013. The SDR project will develop a website for browsing, subsetting, downloading, and visualizing data from the SDR project. This website is currently under construction. Meanwhile, I made a Shiny app with basic functionalities of the future on-line browsing and subsetting tool (also serves as its mock-up): https://mkolczynska.

item.title: Exploring the dataset of survey datasets: Survey Data Recycling version 1.0
item.description: Introduction Downloading the SDR data Exploring SDR: availability of variables by project Exploring SDR: availability of variables with different formulations Identifying surveys containing selected variables Subsetting the Master File Country coverage plot tl;dr: Combining data from different survey projects creates new opportunities for research, alas, at the cost of increased volume (obviously) and complexity of the data. The Survey Data Recycling project created a dataset with data from 22 international survey projects.
